sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• strontium ranelate has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for use in the European Union (EU)
  • Osteoporosis, Severe, in men at increased risk of fracture: 2 g (1 sachet) ORALLY once daily at bedtime; ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D intake (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)
  • Postmenopausal osteoporosis, Severe, in women at high risk for fracture: 2 g (1 sachet) ORALLY once daily at bedtime; ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D intake (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients less than 18 years old

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• renal impairment, severe (CrCl, less than 30 mL/min): use not recommended
  • renal impairment, mild-to-moderate (CrCl, 30 to 70 mL/min): no dosage adjustment required
  • hepatic impairment: no dosage adjustment required
  • elderly: no dosage adjustment required

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Osteoporosis, Severe, in men at increased risk of fracture
  • Postmenopausal osteoporosis, Severe, in women at high risk for fracture

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• cerebrovascular disease, current or history of
  • hypersensitivity to strontium ranelate or any component of the product
  • immobilization, temporary or permanent (eg, postsurgical recovery, prolonged bed rest)
  • ischemic heart disease, current or history of
  • peripheral arterial disease, current or history of
  • uncontrolled hypertension
  • VTE, current or history of, including DVT or pulmonary embolism

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • --myocardial infarction has been reported in postmenopausal women; baseline screening and monitoring recommended; discontinuation may be required
  • -- VTE has been reported; treat at-risk patients with caution and interrupt treatment with onset of immobility; discontinue if condition occurs
  • -- treatment of patients with significant cardiovascular risk factors (eg, smoking, diabetes, hyperlipidemia, hypertension) warrants special caution; monitoring recommended; discontinuation may be required
  • -- uncontrolled hypertension, ischemic heart disease, or peripheral vascular disease; discontinue if conditions occur
  • Dermatologic Effects:
  • -- life-threatening cutaneous reactions such as Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, drug rash with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms may rarely occur, with increased risk among Asian patients; monitoring recommended and immediate discontinuation required if condition is suspected
  • Neurologic:
  • -- cerebrovascular disease; discontinue if condition occurs
  • Renal Effects:
  • -- not recommended for patients with severe renal impairment (ie, CrCl less than 30 mL/min); discontinuation may be required if severe renal impairment develops during therapy
  • -- monitoring recommended in patients with chronic renal impairment
  • Respiratory Effects:
  • -- pulmonary embolism has been reported; treat at-risk patients with caution and interrupt treatment with onset of immobility; discontinue if condition occurs
  • Other:
  • -- reassess need for continued treatment in elderly patients (ie, over 80 years of age) at risk for VTE
  • -- drug contains phenylalanine, which may harm patients with phenylketonuria
  • Concomitant Use:
  • -- do not coadminister with oral tetracyclines (eg, doxycycline) or quinolone antibiotics (eg, ciprofloxacin)
  • -- coadministration with calcium-containing food and supplements at the same time may decrease absorption; separate administration by 2 or more hours

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Eczema (1% to less than 10%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea, Nausea (1% to less than 10%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Increased creatine kinase level (1% to less than 10%), Musculoskeletal pain (10% or greater)
  • Neurologic:Amnesia (1% to less than 10%), Disturbance of consciousness (1% to less than 10%), Headache (1% to less than 10%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Myocardial infarction (1.7%), Venous thromboembolism (1% to less than 10%)
  • Dermatologic:Drug hypersensitivity syndrome, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, Toxic epidermal necrolysis
  • Neurologic:Seizure (0.1% to less than 1%)
  • Respiratory:Asthma (1% to less than 10%)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • suspend granules in at least 30 mL of water and drink immediately
  • do not take with food or milk
  • take at bedtime, preferably at least 2 hours after eating
  • calcium and vitamin D supplementation recommended if dietary intake insufficient

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• Lowered incidence of osteoporotic fractures is indicative of efficacy.
  • cardiovascular risk, before treatment initiation and every 6 to 12 months
  • renal function, periodically in patients with chronic renal impairment
  • VTE risk; reevaluate continued treatment in patients over 80 years of age at risk for VTE
